awd_titl_txt: Dimensional Scaling Techniques Applied to Excited States    of Atoms (Physics)
awd_abstract_narration: The dimensional scaling approach used successfully in                      elementary particle theory is applied to problems in atomic                     physics.  Applications already made to bound state problems                     suggest that the method, like other perturbation theories, has                  some potential as a quantitative tool in atomic physics.  The                   applications anticipated here are to problems involving the                     doubly excited states of He. These states are autoionizing and                  the work would be the first such application of the 1/D                         expansion to the continuum problem.  The method has the                         advantage that it treats collective motion of the particles                     much more easily than other approaches.  This is important for                  an accurate description of the excited states of He.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
